title: Historical Location - WOW
text:
WOW, we had a visit to the Acropolis on the bucket list, and it did not disappoint.
This is a place that has to be seen to be believed.
The views over Athens are stunning, the history is to be marveled at. There is just so much more to see than just the Parthenon. It is certainly a place you need to take a guided tour so you can get a more detailed understanding of the history, the buildings at what is being undertaken in the restoration process.
A DEFINITE MUST DO.

title: Historical location
text: There are so many lovely places in Corfu, and the Liston sits at the top of the list. We found a Cafe of an extremely hot day and stopped for a gelato and a drink. Definitely worth a stop.

title: Amazing views on a challenging journey
text:
The track was certainly challenging, though well worth the effort. We did it on a scorching hot day and needed a lot of water on the way, which luckily we carried. Just a heads up, you do need to pay a track fee, though this is some way up the track.
The views were amazing and made for great photo opportunities.
As I said, it was well worth the effort, and yes I would do it again.

title: Incredible History
text:
There is nothing like actually visiting the Colosseum in person. The sheer size of the place and the atmosphere. We did the tour WithLocals and got a skip the line pass, which is well worth doing. With so many things to see and do it was good to have a local who spoke English and gave us a great insight into the historical aspects.
The Colosseum is a must do when in Rome.

title: Amazing place
text: Our hotel was just down the road so we were able to visit the Pantheon a number of times when it was least busy. An amazing place with a unique atmosphere that has stood the test of time. This is a MUST DO in Rome, you will not be disappointed.

title: Location Location Location
text: You could not ask for a better location to sit down, have a drink and a bit of food. The service was great and the quality of the food worth the stop, and all across from the harbour.

title: A MUST DO in Venice
text:
What more can you say...... once in Venice a Gondola ride is a must do.
We had the opportunity to go on the back canals during a quiet period and had such an awesome time.
The photo opportunities were everywhere, and our Gondolier very knowledgeable and talkative. We learnt just so much.
As I said, do not miss this.............

title: Interesting .......BUT
text:
This free opportunity was recommended to us by the Hotel, and we took up the offer. A good boat trip over, winding through the various back canals on a beautiful day.

To see the master at work blowing the glass was well worth the trip, The downside however was after the glass blowing, a very pushy sales person, guide escorted us through the sales area which put real real dampener on the time there.

Unfortunately based on the sales person, it is not an experience I would recommend. I have to say the people we traveled back to San Marco had the same thoughts. If you buy nothing, don't expect to be dropped back where you were picked up from.

This was our only negative experience in Venice.

title: A great family meal
text: What a great location, superb service and a meal definitely worth it. The three of us all enjoyed a great meal in a place with a superb atmosphere. Recommended to all.

title: A MUST DO in Venice
text: This is a must visit place in Venice. Having tried a few Gelato, Suso is definitely one on the best.All good things take time and this place is so popular, you may have to wait a little, though it is well worth it. Do not be disappointed.

title: WOW, Everything for the sweet tooth
text: Absolutely loved the opportunity to look around Captain Candy and pick up some treats that we do not get in New Zealand. Loved the variety and brought a few more sweets that we intended. Absolutely delicious.

title: Great Atmosphere
text: In the main street of La Spezia we enjoyed a quiet beer and a few snacks. The service was great and atmosphere as you would expect. Well worth a stop.

title: Amazing views of Malta's Harbour
text:
Getting the lift upto the Gardens is well worth the effort, the views are amazing. There is also the opportunity to get something to eat, or just walk into town and visit the shops.
Just do it.

title: A brilliant little Piazza
text: Taormina is an amazing place perched upon a cliff. The Duomo is a small church with and great fountain out front with some amazing carvings. Definitely worth a visit when on the Taormina streets.

title: Spectacular
text:
We traveled as part of of a cruise ship shore excursion as Pompeii was on the "bucket list".
The place is amazing and exceeded all our expectations. We would love to have spent more time, though really enjoyed the time we had. Having access to a guide certainly added a different dimension, and gave us a great understanding of the site and what actually happened.
It is one thing to see history on TV, but to actually visit the site, brings the enormity of what actually happened into reality.
Pompeii is a must do.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
The welcome to the Roda Al Murooj exceeded all expectations. The staff were all extremely professional, friendly and helpful. The restaurant, cafe and all facilities "top notch", with the buffet for breakfast and evening meal varied and substantial.
The use of the pools and facilities during the hot days made our stay memorable as did the thoughtfulness and support of all the staff.
We would certainly recommend the Roda Al Murooj to everyone and will definitely be back.
Thanks for the wonderful stay.

title: An Amazing Hotel
text:
Located in the an area a short walk from all the major attractions, including the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Venezia, the Colosseum and Vatican City.
Hotel Barrett exceeded all our expectations. The room was clean and well appointed and the service of all staff was excellent.
The atmosphere just added another dimension to our stay in Rome.
We would certainly recommend Hotel Barrett to all, and would definitely stay again.

title: A great apartment
text: A perfect location close to di Piazza del Popolo and a very short walk to the main street. The two bedroom apartment was clean and well maintained. Our hosts were great and made us feel extremely welcome. The kitchen and dining room made us feel like we were at home. Thanks so much for everything.

title: Great hospitality and a central location
text:
Antonio was a superb host. The staff looked after us well. The room was great, well appointed and maintained, and having access to a common room and shared kitchen definitely added to the experience.
The Hotel Boutique Santa Maria Nouvella is close to the train station and easy walking distance to the shops, markets and all the landmarks. It is certainly a place we would highly recommend to anyone visiting Florence.
Thanks Antonio.

title: Excellent Location
text: We arrived in La Spezia and the Novocento was only a short walk from the train station. The hotel is centrally located with it's own courtyard area, and so close to the main shopping and eating areas. The staff were friendly and helpful and put on a good breakfast each morning.

title: Centrally located
text:
An excellent hotel centrally located, with extremely friendly and helpful staff. The buffet breakfast was great, the rooms clean and all this within easy walking distance of the old town, and the waterfront.
Recommended to all.

title: Location, location, location
text:
We stayed at the Montecarlo for three nights at the start of holiday and were extremely satisfied with the amazing hospitality.
You step out the door onto a narrow alley with an amazing array of shops, and all so close to the Piazza de San Marco and the Rialto bridge. It would be hard to find a more central location.
We would certainly recommend this lovely quaint hotel to anyone visiting Venice. It is clean, we serviced, has an amazing breakfast, along with extremely helpful and knowledgeable staff.

title: A beautiful, historical and picturesque place
text:
What an amazing place the Old City of Kotor is. The narrow streets seem to be straight out of the "pied piper" movie, It is absolutely enchanting, with fortified walls, boutique shops, grandiose churches, beautiful cafes and an amazing fortress on the top of the mountain...
Getting into Kotor by cruise ship is also an experience with Old City Kotor at the end of a magnificent fjord.
A beautiful, picturesque City, well worth a visit, with it's rich in history and culture.. You will not be disappointed.

title: The past blended with the present
text: We did a cruise ship excursion off the MSC Magnifica, and were absolutely stunned by Olympia. It has always been on my "bucket list" and certainly did not disappoint. To stand where athletes did thousands of years ago, just brought into perspective what they did and how the modern Olympics continue the tradition. This is a place that will amaze you. The day we were there was so hot and the local Red Cross were out in force with water. A credit to everyone, and a place well worth the visit.

title: A great stop over
text: The mall has such a great variety of shops, and things to do. We spent a few hours wandering around, though could have spent much more time. A credit to all.

title: Great sushi in La Spezia
text: We could not fault the food or the service. The place has a great atmosphere and I would recommend to all.

title: Just like home ........
text: It is always great to be able to arrive at a Starbucks and know you are going to get a quality drink, with great service and a familiar atmosphere. Marseille was no different. Well done.

title: Good location
text: Stayed overnight on a business trip and would certainly recommend to others. It is a short walk into Cuba Street and Victoria University. The staff were extremely professional, polite and accommodating. The rooms are well appointed and have some views which is always an added bonus. Would definitely stay at the Grand Mercure next time in Wellington.

title: Centrally loacated
text: The second time this year and as always the service and professionalism of the staff makes Breakfree on George stand out. The hotel is close to everything, Paddy's Markets, Capitol Theatre, Darling Harbour and a shortwalk into central Sydney.Central and Town Hall train stations are only a short walk away, so wider Sydney is open to enjoy.Thanks again to the staff and management, we will be back.

title: Tranquility in a bustling city
text: What an amazing place in central Sydney. We had a great time strolling around at our leisure and saw a lot of bearded lizards. There are great photo opportunities and the chance to just sit down and take in the tranquility of the place. The Chinese Garden of Friendship is definitely worth a visit.

title: An asset to Sydney and the habour
text:
Its has been 18 months since we were last in Sydney and it was great to see all the work progressing along the Barangaroo area.
Lots of cafes, apartments and specialty upmarket stores. We strolled down from Haymarket, through Darling Harbour, along the Barangaroo Foreshore and over to the Rocks.
As mentioned in the title this is definitely an asset to Sydney, though we need wait and be patient for it to be fully completed.

title: An Amazing Shop for people of all ages
text:
We visited the Forest of Wisdom shop in Picton and were totally blown away.
A lot of thought has gone into the layout of the shop as it is so easy to move around and has something for all ages.
Along with the Psychic Readings the Forest of Wisdom covers all the bases for those on a spiritual journey or those just wanting to pick up some great gifts.
The shop has a great atmosphere from the moment you walk in with the sound of trickling water and the smell of incense which has the feeling of taking you on a journey.
The variety of items in the shop includes crystals, oils, candles, books, CD's, a fantasy area and a Fairy Garden, organic teas, Tarot & Oracle cards and so much more.
If you are in the Picton area, a visit to the Forest of Wisdom is a must.
Well done to all involved, we will certainly be back.

title: Great location on the Beach
text:
We caught up with a friend in Manly and they recommended the Pantry on Manly Beach, and we were not disappointed.
The service was great, the food superb and all the while looking out over the beach.
You could not ask for a better location.

title: Bistro over the Bay
text:
Stopped in for a coffee at the Bistro and along with the amazing views we had a great coffee.Very relaxing.
We would definitely recommend to others and only a couple of minutes walk from the Manly Ferry.

title: Nice location
text: Visited the Kiama Blowhole and got a chance to see it play, though not at full tide. Worth a stop though check out the tides and winds.

title: The Cool Room Emporium
text:
We visited the Coolroom Emporium and found it to be a great place with so much variety. There is just so much from new & pre-loved clothing, bric a brac and collectibles, books, old records, old linen and much more.
Definitely worth a visit if you are in Robertson..

title: Excellent location overlooking Main Beach at the Mount
text: The location, service, coffee and muffins were great. It is good to be able to just sit down, relax and watch the world go by. We will be back.

title: It has to be one of the best beaches in New Zealand
text:
Beautiful sand with an amazing surf that is safe for all.
Papamoa beach has so much to offer from sunbathing, swimming, lifesaving facilities and fishing to just chilling out and walking along a pristine piece of NZ coastline.
As I said, "it would have to be one of the best beaches in NZ" and certainly worthy of a visit.

title: Worth the visit
text: The tea, coffee and hot chocolate are always great and the cabinet food homemade. This all adds to the atmosphere at the Eastern which has the facility to sit inside or out. If you are passing, it is worthwhile calling in.

title: Great space in the middle of Sydney
text: A nice tranquil place in the middle of Sydney that is well looked after.If you are in Sydney it is well worth taking the time to walk from Central Sydney or take a train.

title: Always a standout
text:
We hopped the Manly Ferry on a beautiful Sydney day and went across to catch up with friends in Manly.
What a beautiful day with a little breeze and a wonderful sunset coming back.
Also got to see a cruise ship leaving the harbour.
Sydney harbour is an amazing place with the chance to see all the icons of Sydney including the Sydney harbour bridge, Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay, Luna Park and a short walk to the Rocks.
Never disappoints.

title: A great night on Valentines Day
text: Went to Latitude on Valentines Day and had a brilliant time. A great variety of small and large meals, We had the pork belly and the bucket of latitude chicken and chips (could not miss the dessert) along with a glass of cider. A beautiful meal, excellent service and great ambiance. We will definitely visit again.

title: Great Cafe with some privacy
text: Our World of Taste experience was great. The cabinet food selection was impressive as was the service. We have been back a few times now and I even plan business meetings there when passing through as there are private areas.See you all again shortly.

title: Great atmosphere
text: Pap house has an amazing atmosphere, a good selection of craft beers and the food is superb.Pap House caters for the families, trades and the staff make everyone feel at home. Love the food, especially the spares rids, sliders and chips.

title: Good
text: Great coffee though not too much variety in the cabinet while we were there. It is off the beaten track so you have to go there as a destination or be visiting Comvita.

title: Kiwifruit Country
text: The business has closed an in part relocated just down the road. It is now known as Kiwifruit Country and the owners are passionate about delivering an exceptional experience. See Kiwifruit Country or Kiwifruit Orchard Tours which is one and the same.

title: So much to do
text: Great for the family. So much to see and do including great restaurants. It is so close to downtown, just a short walk.

title: Amazing place
text: The animal and bird life in the Okavango Delta is simply amazing. The variety of camps just adds to the experience as does the opportunity to do game drives, treks or go on the waterways in the canoes. If you want an amazing experience you must choose the Okavango Delta.

title: Great atmosphere
text:
Having been to Scope a few times now with business associates, family and friends I thought it was about time I completed a review.
Scope is well located, has a great selection of food and the coffee and service are excellent. Recommended to all.

title: Amazing Reserve
text:
We flew in from Maun and absolutely loved our time at the Moremi Wildlife Reserve. Definitely plan a trip outside the rainy season, The variety of wildlife is amazing with everything from Giraffe, Elephants, Water buffalo and monkeys. The game drives we went on at Okuti were brilliant, we even got out on the water and saw hippos in the water and lots of bird life.
Well worth a trip.

title: Great Hotel
text: We spent a couple of nights at the Taj Chandigarh and it was an excellent experience from the welcome at the door, the check in to the service of all the staff. The room was well appointed and up to the standard if what you would expect at a 5 star hotel. The restaurant had a great selection and the breakfasts superb. Well done the Taj.

title: Great Variety
text: We visited Elante Mall to have a meal and were not disappointed by all the options available. After dinner we spent quite a bit of time around the shops and the girls had a ball. Would definitely recommend a visit.

title: Great place, great atmosphere
text: As a tourist destination the community has a lot of touristy type shops which are well worth taking the time to browse through. We popped into the spices shop and were very warmly greeted and were made to feel at home. A definite stopping place.

title: Worth the Visit
text: An historical church which has an amazing ambiance about it. The old material fans and the pews just added to the overall experience. The Church of Saint Francis is well worth the visit.

title: Modern Mall
text: We found the Lulu Mall a great place to have a meal and browse an incredible range of shops. On a wet day I have no doubt you could just chill out and forget about whats happening outside. Worth the visit.

title: Amazing Place
text:
Humayun's Tomb is a must do when in New Delhi.
Having been to the Taj Mahal we were a little skeptical, though really enjoyed our time here. The buildings, architecture and grounds were well looked after, clean, tidy and simply amazing. There are so many opportunities to get some great photos. Definitely visit Humayun's Tomb and when there just take your time as you will not be disappointed.

title: Tranquility
text: The Lotus Temple was so different to other places we had visited. Although busy we got around the gardens and Temple quite easily as the staff / volunteers managed the flow extremely well. The architecture of the Temple itself is quite amazing which radiates a type of pearl lustre. Don't miss the Bahai Lotus Temple.

title: Great history
text: We really enjoyed the visit to the museum and got a far better understanding of Gandhi's role in the history of India. Although small there is so much to see. There are a number of stairs and narrow hallways which could make it difficult for some people wishing to visit.

title: Great location
text:
We popped in to have a look at the Boatyard and although we were not staying there we had a chat with the management and they organised a fully guided tour of the premises.
I have to say we were extremely impressed with the rooms, the tidiness and cleanliness of the place and when back in Cochin we will certainly be staying. Having said that the rooms were all well appointed, the pool, proximity to the sea and the bar and restaurant all world class.
Well done to the management and staff.

title: Crowded
text: We drove down Marine Drive returning to our hotel and the place was extremely busy, a real hive of activity. From the car the beach looked fairly average, though the amenities were many and varied.
